bard.name: bard
bard.label: Bard
bard.desc: It might not seem conventional to bring a guitar to a sword fight, but once you see a bard at work you will understand. They use their gifts of music to weave magical sonnets, bolstering their allies and weakening their foes. Rock on.
bard.proficiencies: Light Armour, Simple Weapons, Small Weapons, Medium Weapons, Ranged Weapons, Magic Weapons, Small Shields

skills.name: fasthands
skills.label: Fast Hands
skills.desc: Bards can inexplicably play a musical instrument in their off hand while wielding a weapon in their main hand. Even if the instrument requires two hands. Don't question it.

cleric.name: cleric
cleric.label: Cleric
cleric.desc: Clerics are devoted to helping the living stay living, and as such in combat they are focused on healing their teammates.
cleric.proficiencies: Light Armour, Medium Armour, Simple Weapons, Small Weapons, Medium Weapons, Small Shields

skills.name: lesserheal
skills.label: Lesser Heal
skills.desc: channel healing spirits through your weapon, healing <weapon> health on an ally within line of sight

skills.name: holylight
skills.label: Holy Light
skills.desc: Attack SPI vs SPI on an enemy within 10m, on hit does weapon + SPI light damage, does an additional 1d6 damage to undead enemies.

enchanter.name: enchanter
enchanter.label: Enchanter
enchanter.desc: Enchanters are the masters of the mind, using their magical abilities to control and confuse enemies. Main roles in battle are crowd control and damage.

skills.name: sensemind
skills.label: Sense Mind
skills.desc: the enchanter can roll a CHA check out of combat to attempt to peer into a targets mind and detect their intentions.

skills.name: charm
skills.label: Charm
skills.desc: Attack CHA vs CHA on an enemy within 10m, if it hits the enemy is charmed until the end of their next turn.

monk.name: monk
monk.label: Monk
monk.desc: Monks avoid wearing armour and wielding weapons, and rather aim to hone their body into the ultimate weapon by mastering the martial arts and harnessing their inner spirit.

skills.name: fistsofrock
skills.label: Fists Of Rock
skills.desc: A monks fists are classed as 1d4+STR weapons (increase to 2d4 at level 5, 3d4 at level 10, 4d4 at level 15 and 5d4 at level 20

skills.name: kick
skills.label: Kick
skills.desc: Attack vs dodge on a enemy within melee range, if it hits the target takes 1d8+STR damage and is knocked down.

skills.name: ignorepain
skills.label: Ignore Pain
skills.desc: the monk gains 1d4+SPI temporary hit points (increases to 2d4 at level 5, 3d4 at level 10, 4d4 at level 15 and 5d4 at level 20)

necromancer.name: necromancer
necromancer.label: Necromancer
necromancer.desc: To some, death is not something to be feared but to be harnessed for power. Necromancers study and hone their ability to control the forces of life and death directly. Their main role in combat is damage.

skills.name: absorb
skills.label: Absorb
skills.desc: When the necromancer does dark damage to an enemy, they gain 1 health (increases to 2 at level 5, 3 at level 10, 4 at level 15 and 5 at level 20).

skills.name: animatebones
skills.label: Animate Bones
skills.desc: raise a skeleton from the dead under the characters control. It has (1d4 + CON) * level health, 3 movement, 0 Dodge, 1 Armour, 1d20 + INT attack, and does 1d4 + INT physical damage.

paladin.name: paladin
paladin.label: Paladin
paladin.desc: A cross between a Warrior and a Cleric, Paladins combine their fighting abilities with healing spells. They are also particularly effective against undead enemies. Paladins can either focus on a tanking role, or as a healer.
paladin.proficiencies: Light Armour, Medium Armour, Heavy Armour, Simple Weapons, Small Weapons, Medium Weapons, Large Weapons, Small Shields, Medium Shields

archetypes.label: Avenger
archetypes.desc: The paladin gains Large Weapon Fighting (+2 to attack and damage rolls when using a two handed weapon) and Smite (once per round the paladin can use his bonus action to cast an evocation spell).

archetypes.label: Protector
archetypes.desc: The paladin gains Heavy Defense (no longer takes the negative effects of wearing heavy armour and holding a shield) and Protect (once per round the paladin can use his bonus action to cast an abjuration spell).

archetypes.label: Healer
archetypes.desc: The paladin can now use Lay On Hands twice per long rest, and all his healing spells gain an additional 1d6+2.

skills.name: courage
skills.label: Courage
skills.desc: All allies within 3m of the Paladin gain +1 to attack rolls (increases to 2 at level 5, 3 at level 10, 4 at level 15 and 5 at level 20).

skills.name: layonhands
skills.label: Lay On Hands
skills.desc: the paladin touches a friendly target (this can include themselves), healing the target to full health.

skills.name: lightmagic1
skills.label: Light Magic 1
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 1 Light magic spells and 1 rank 1 spell slot (increases to 2 slots at level 3, 3 at level 5 and 4 at level 7).

skills.name: sacredoath
skills.label: Sacred Oath
skills.desc: The paladin takes his sacred oath, finally committing to a code. This can be: Oath of Ancients (The paladin selects one of the fathers/spirits and devotes himself to serving them, gaining Divine Intervention (Reaction - once per long rest - when the paladin takes damage that would reduce him to 0 health, he is instead healed for that damage), Oath of Conquest (The paladin revels in the glory of battle, gaining Aura of Conquest (Passive - the paladin and nearby allies within 1m of a defeated foe gain health equal to the foes hit die)) or Oath of Justice (The paladin devotes himself to the pursuit of justice for all and gains Truthbringer - once per short rest the paladin can compel a character to speak truthfully for SPI minutes. Unwilling characters must make a SPI saving throw vs 10+SPI).

skills.name: divineshield
skills.label: Divine Shield
skills.desc: the paladin surrounds himself in holy energy, stunning him next round but blocking all damage he would receive next round.

skills.name: resistance
skills.label: Resistance
skills.desc: The character gains 1 point of magic reduction (increases to 2 at level 10, 3 at level 15 and 4 at level 20)

skills.name: divineweapon
skills.label: Divine Weapon
skills.desc: the paladin enchants his weapon with holy energy and attacks immediately, dealing weapon damage plus 1d6+SPI light damage. Deals an additional 1d6 to undead or demons.

skills.name: lightmagic2
skills.label: Light Magic 2
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 2 Light magic spells and 1 rank 2 spell slot (increases to 2 slots at level 9 and 3 at level 11).

skills.name: weaponmastery
skills.label: Weapon Mastery
skills.desc: The character chooses a weapon type, they now receive a +1 to all attack and damage rolls with that weapon.

skills.name: choosearchetype
skills.label: Choose Archetype
skills.desc: The Paladin chooses to specialize in an archetype, either Avenger, Protector or Healer.

skills.name: extraattack
skills.label: Extra Attack
skills.desc: The character may choose to spend his 'bonus action' to make a regular attack with their main weapon, even if they already attacked this round.

skills.name: lightmagic3
skills.label: Light Magic 3
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 3 Light magic spells and 1 rank 3 spell slot (increases to 2 slots at level 15).

skills.name: avatar
skills.label: Avatar
skills.desc: The paladin becomes an avatar of the gods, gaining +2 to all primary stats, 1d6+SPI temporary health, 5 armour and 5 magic reduction for 3 rounds.

skills.name: lightmagic4
skills.label: Light Magic 4
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 4 Light magic spells and 1 rank 4 spell slot.

ranger.name: ranger
ranger.label: Ranger
ranger.desc: Rangers are solitary characters often at one with nature. They make exceptional trackers and are proficient with ranged weapons. They can also go toe to toe with enemies if required.
ranger.proficiencies: Light Armour, Simple Weapons, Small Weapons, Medium Weapons, Ranged Weapons

archetypes.label: Archer
archetypes.desc: The ranger now gains Retreat (once per round, the ranger can use their bonus action to move 1 space away from an enemy within melee range), they also gain +5 range when using any ranged weapon.

archetypes.label: Marauder
archetypes.desc: The ranger gains Advance (once per round, the ranger can use their bonus action to move 1 space towards the nearest enemy) and Ambidexterity (the character no longer rolls with disadvantage on offhand attacks).

archetypes.label: Warg
archetypes.desc: The ranger gains Project Mind (once per long rest, the ranger can project his consciousness into his animal companion for 1 hour). His animal companion also becomes dire, gaining 1d4 health per ranger level, 2 armour, 2 magic reduction and Extra Attack.

skills.name: tracker
skills.label: Tracker
skills.desc: the ranger gains +1 to perception checks (increases to +2 at level 5, +3 at level 10, +4 at level 15 and +5 at level 20)

skills.name: headshot
skills.label: Headshot
skills.desc: perform a ranged attack as normal, on hit it is considered critical, doing maximum damage.

skills.name: naturemagic1
skills.label: Nature Magic 1
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 1 Nature magic spells and 1 rank 1 spell slot (increases to 2 slots at level 3, 3 at level 5 and 4 at level 7).

skills.name: naturalattunement
skills.label: Natural Attunement
skills.desc: The ranger now uses his spirit when making perception checks

skills.name: animalcompanion
skills.label: Animal Companion
skills.desc: The ranger calls forth an animal companion (hawk, panther, wolf or bear). The animal becomes the rangers companion indefinitely until the ranger chooses to change it. The companion's stats depend on the type of animal and level of ranger and it can be commanded in battle.

skills.name: resistance
skills.label: Resistance
skills.desc: The character gains 1 point of magic reduction (increases to 2 at level 10, 3 at level 15 and 4 at level 20)

skills.name: extraattack
skills.label: Extra Attack
skills.desc: The character may choose to spend his 'bonus action' to make a regular attack with their main weapon, even if they already attacked this round.

skills.name: dualwield
skills.label: Dual Wield
skills.desc: The character can equip a small weapon in their offhand. When making an attack with their main weapon, they may also make a regular attack with their off hand with disadvantage.

skills.name: naturemagic2
skills.label: Nature Magic 2
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 2 Nature magic spells and 1 rank 2 spell slot (increases to 2 slots at level 9 and 3 at level 11).

skills.name: weaponmastery
skills.label: Weapon Mastery
skills.desc: The character chooses a weapon type, they now receive a +1 to all attack and damage rolls with that weapon.

skills.name: choosearchetype
skills.label: Choose Archetype
skills.desc: The Ranger chooses to specialize in an archetype, either Archer, Marauder or Warg.

skills.name: naturemagic3
skills.label: Nature Magic 3
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 3 Nature magic spells and 1 rank 3 spell slot (increases to 2 slots at level 15).

skills.name: Nature's Furt
skills.label: Nature Magic 3
skills.desc: The ranger and his animal companion enter a fury state, both gaining +5 attack and +5 damage for 3 rounds.

skills.name: naturemagic4
skills.label: Nature Magic 4
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 4 Nature magic spells and 1 rank 4 spell slot.

reaver.name: reaver
reaver.label: Reaver
reaver.desc: Known as 'dark paladins', Reavers are a cross between a Warrior and a Necromancer, employing a mix of physical abilities and dark magic in combat. Reavers can focus on tanking or damage roles.
reaver.proficiencies: Light Armour, Medium Armour, Heavy Armour, Simple Weapons, Small Weapons, Medium Weapons, Large Weapons, Small Shields, Medium Shields

skills.name: fear
skills.label: Fear
skills.desc: enemies within melee range of the reaver suffer -1 to attack rolls (increases to -2 at level 5, -3 at level 10, -4 at level 15 and -5 at level 20)

skills.name: harmtouch
skills.label: Harm Touch
skills.desc: Attack INT vs INT on an enemy within melee range, causing 1d8 + (1d4 per level) + INT dark damage, the Reaver then becomes exhausted

rogue.name: rogue
rogue.label: Rogue
rogue.desc: Rogues like to stay in the shadows, remaining hidden and striking enemies from behind. Thought rogues like to be up close with enemies to do large amounts of damage, they can't afford to take many hits.
rogue.proficiencies: Light Armour, Simple Weapons, Small Weapons

archetypes.label: Alchemist
archetypes.desc: The rogue specialises in his poisons, gaining Bottled Death (The rogue can bottle his poisons, and throw them in battle to poison enemies) and Potent Poisons (all poisons gain +3 strength).

archetypes.label: Assassin
archetypes.desc: The rogue specializes in stealth, gaining Improved Backstab (the rogue can now use backstab when on the side of an enemy) and a +2 to all stealth checks.

archetypes.label: Fencer
archetypes.desc: The rogue specializes in his fighting abilities, gaining Ambidexterity (the character no longer rolls with disadvantage on offhand attacks) as well as Riposte (once per short rest, when the rogue dodges an attack, they may immediately make a regular attack with their main weapon against the attacker.

skills.name: backstab
skills.label: Backstab
skills.desc: Make an attack from behind a target, if it hits the rogue deals weapon damage +1d4 and their damage stat modifier becomes (AGI+STR)/2 (increases to +2d4 at level 5, 3d4 at level 10, 4d4 at level 15, and 5d4 at level 20). Piercing weapon required.

skills.name: thievery
skills.label: Thievery
skills.desc: the rogue receives +1 to any checks relating to lockpicking or pickpocketing (increases to +2 at level 5, +3 at level 10, +4 at level 15 and +5 at level 20).

skills.name: poisons1
skills.label: Poisons 1
skills.desc: The rogue now has access to rank 1 poisons.

skills.name: applypoison
skills.label: Apply Poison
skills.desc: The rogue can apply 1 dose of poison to a weapon within reach. The poison lasts for one encounter.

skills.name: tumble
skills.label: Tumble
skills.desc: When an enemy makes an attack on the rogue, before dice are rolled, the rogue may choose to dodge up to 1 square and avoid the attack.

skills.name: dualwield
skills.label: Dual Wield
skills.desc: The character can equip a small weapon in their offhand. When making an attack with their main weapon, they may also make a regular attack with their off hand with disadvantage.

skills.name: keeneye
skills.label: Keen Eye
skills.desc: the rogues attack rolls of 19 and 20 count as critical.

skills.name: resistance
skills.label: Resistance
skills.desc: The character gains 1 point of magic reduction (increases to 2 at level 10, 3 at level 15 and 4 at level 20)

skills.name: weaponmastery
skills.label: Weapon Mastery
skills.desc: The character chooses a weapon type, they now receive a +1 to all attack and damage rolls with that weapon.

skills.name: poisons2
skills.label: Poisons 2
skills.desc: The rogue now has access to rank 2 poisons.

skills.name: extraattack
skills.label: Extra Attack
skills.desc: The character may choose to spend his 'bonus action' to make a regular attack with their main weapon, even if they already attacked this round.

skills.name: choosearchetype
skills.label: Choose Archetype
skills.desc: The Rogue chooses to specialize in an archetype, either Alchemist, Assassin or Fencer.

skills.name: poisons3
skills.label: Poisons3
skills.desc: The rogue now has access to rank 3 poisons.

skills.name: poisons4
skills.label: Poisons 4
skills.desc: The rogue now has access to rank 4 poisons.

skills.name: keeneye2
skills.label: Keen Eye 2
skills.desc: the rogues attack rolls of 18, 19 and 20 count as critical.

skills.name: vanish
skills.label: Vanish
skills.desc: The rogue vanishes into the shadows, becoming invisible for the next 3 rounds even while attacking.

skills.name: poisons5
skills.label: Poisons 5
skills.desc: The rogue now has access to rank 5 poisons.

shaman.name: shaman
shaman.label: Shaman
shaman.desc: Primal and ritualistic, shamans channel the energies of their ancestors to heal and bolster their allies, as well as harness the weather to damage their enemies.
shaman.proficiencies: Light Armour, Medium Armour, Simple Weapons, Small Weapons, Medium Weapons, Small Shields

skills.name: lesserheal
skills.label: Lesser Heal
skills.desc: channel healing spirits through your weapon, healing <weapon>+SPI health on an ally within line of sight

skills.name: lightningbolt
skills.label: Lightning Bolt
skills.desc: Attack SPI vs SPI on an enemy within 10m, on hit does <weapon>+SPI light damage and the enemy is stunned.

warrior.desc: The masters of arms, warriors are commonly found at the front of battle clad in heavy armour. They have a wide variety of available weapons, shields and armour. Warriors are one of the few classes to not directly employ magic in any way, and generally do not trust it.
warrior.label: Warrior
warrior.name: warrior
warrior.proficiencies: Light Armour, Medium Armour, Heavy Armour, Simple Weapons, Small Weapons, Medium Weapons, Large Weapons, Ranged Weapons, Small Shields, Medium Shields, Large Shields

skills.name: berserk
skills.label: Berserk
skills.desc: The character enters a state of rage when wounded, dealing +1d6 damage on all attacks (increases to +2d6 at level 7, +3d6 at level 13, and +4d6 at level 19)

skills.name: tauntingstrike
skills.label: Taunting Strike
skills.desc: Attack vs dodge, if it hits deal weapon damage and the target must attack you on their next turn

wizard.desc: Harnessing Arcane magic, wizards unleash fury upon their foes. They are the strongest spell casters in terms of raw damage output.
wizard.label: Wizard
wizard.name: wizard

archetypes.label: Archmage
archetypes.desc: Becoming a master of the arcane, the wizard gains 1 spell slot in each rank they have access to, and Multicast (Once per round the wizard can spend his bonus action to cast a non-evocation spell).

archetypes.label: Battlemage
archetypes.desc: The wizard gains proficiency in Medium and Heavy armours as well as Small Shields. He also gains a +1 to attack when wielding summoned magic weapons.

archetypes.label: Summoner
archetypes.desc: The wizard's familiar now has it's own stats (TODO) and can be re-summoned during a long rest if it dies. All other summoned creatures also gain 1 armour, 1 magic reduction, +2 attack and 1d8 damage.

skills.name: bookworm
skills.label: Bookworm
skills.desc: The wizard gains +1 to any knowledge checks (increases to +2 at level 5, +3 at level 10, +4 at level 15 and +5 at level 20).

skills.name: arcanemagic1
skills.label: Arcane Magic 1
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 1 Arcane magic spells and 2 rank 1 spell slots (increases to 3 slots at level 2, 4 at level 4 and 5 at level 5)

skills.name: focus
skills.label: Focus
skills.desc: The wizard chooses one school of magic (Alteration, Abjuration, Conjuration, Evocation and Illusion). All spells with that tag gain a +1 to all rolls.

skills.name: familiar
skills.label: Familiar
skills.desc: The wizard chooses a familiar. The familiar is instantly summoned and by the wizards side at all times. It shares all stats (including health and any existing buffs) with the wizard and does 1d4+INT damage.

skills.name: arcanemagic2
skills.label: Arcane Magic 2
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 2 Arcane magic spells and 1 rank 2 spell slot (increases to 2 slots at level 5, 3 at level 6, and 4 at level 7)

skills.name: resistance
skills.label: Resistance
skills.desc: The character gains 1 point of magic reduction (increases to 2 at level 10, 3 at level 15 and 4 at level 20)

skills.name: clearmind
skills.label: Clear Mind
skills.desc: The wizard refreshes a single spent spell slot.

skills.name: sharpmind
skills.label: Sharp Mind
skills.desc: the wizards spell/attack rolls of 19 and 20 count as critical

skills.name: arcanemagic3
skills.label: Arcane Magic 3
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 3 Arcane magic spells and 1 rank 3 spell slot (increases to 2 slots at level 9 and 3 at level 10)

skills.name: manasurge
skills.label: Mana Surge
skills.desc: The wizard may cast a spell of his choice twice this turn. It only counts as a single spell slot use.

skills.name: choosearchetype
skills.label: Choose Archetype
skills.desc: The Wizard chooses to specialize in an archetype, either Archmage, Battlemage or Summmoner.

skills.name: arcanemagic4
skills.label: Arcane Magic 4
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 4 Arcane magic spells and 1 rank 4 spell slot (increases to 2 slots at level 13)

skills.name: masterfulcontrol
skills.label: Masterful Control
skills.desc: The wizard may cast an area based Evocation spell as normal. Any friendly targets within that area are not affected.

skills.name: arcanemagic5
skills.label: Arcane Magic 5
skills.desc: Grants access to rank 5 Arcane magic spells and 1 rank 5 spell slot (increases to 2 slots at level 18)

skills.name: arcanemastery
skills.label: Arcane Mastery
skills.desc: All the wizards spells gain an additional +1 to all rolls and he gains an additional 20 spell slot points on short rests.
